Strengths: fairly light workload
Weaknesses: this class should not be an option to satisfy the EHS course for non-EHS students, as the topic is quite in-depth and requires background knowledge that non-EHS students might not have. Class topics also seem fairly disjointed so it's hard to get a broad course understanding. Class features mostly guest speakers but would like more input from the professor himself. Making discussions but not lectures mandatory and having no relationship between them makes it hard to justify the need for students to go to lectures.
great experience
variety of topics, sometimes over-reaching the knowledge of the class, but very cutting-edge topics discussed
Great course. Especially the field visit. And I really enjoyed the debate sessions on Friday.
This class was very effective and I really enjoyed it

Strengths
+ Supportive and engaged TF
+ Midterm paper allowed us to put what we learned into practice
+ Light workload

Weaknesses
+ Seemed like the professor didn't care about the class considering he didn't show up to half of the classes and most of the discussion sections
+ Discussion section on a Friday at 1pm is not ideal
it seemed much more like a disjointed seminar series than a coherent class. We didn't see prof. Vasiliou for a big chunk of the semester.

The topics are diverse and speakers are good. However, I think this course need to be more structured. The topics are a little fragmented, and the discussion sessions could be used more efficiently. Also, I understand the instructor wanted to give us a comprehensive idea about Tox21, but the contents could be more in-depth.
it's really interesting and encourage me to explore a lot.

The course felt sort of incoherent and disjointed due to having many different speakers and topics. It was sometimes difficult to see how the outlined learning objectives were being met by the course. The debates were always very interesting and fun. The Friday discussion sections seemed somewhat disorganized, and some of the lecturers did not seem happy to be there (e.g., were late, standoffish when asked questions). The assessments were appropriate and fair, and the projects were interesting.
Each class was not linked to the previous week. It would have been better to have a continuum.

I really enjoyed the variety, as well as the freedom in terms of the assignments-- we were able to study topics that suited our interests for the mid-term. Dr. Vasiliou had a very busy schedule though, and most of the instruction and activities were run by Saskia (who did a great job).
Interesting class

This course is a survey course, driven by guest speakers. It is weak, in that, some of the guest speaker formatting required electronic lectures. Additionally, the lectures approached the topics with breadth not, depth. Depth is what drives research, so this course is ill-suited for students in research positions.
Great introduction to many topics of toxicology!

strength: various speakers included
weakness: less lectures from primary instructor, may be fragmented

strength: lecturer from all the fields.
weakness: too broad and not system or goes in deep.
I really enjoyed the way questions were asked to the class.
Very interesting topics.
The overall assessment of the course is great. It touched on many relevant topics  of public health toxicology that we will learn throughout our careers.

Professor Vasilis is clearly very knowledgeable about toxicology but does not translate topics well on an introductory level to students. Would be helpful if lectures were more engaging/encouraged more student participation.
great experience
very friendly, wish he was present all the times in the class
Professor is very nice to his students.
The instructor was very good

General comments:
+ Has a genuine passion for public health toxicology
+ Has very strong opinions regarding alcohol, marijuana, and lowering the IQ of children
+ Did not show up to half of the classes and most of the discussion sections

Overall, I did not see Professor Vasiliou as often in class as I would like, and the class was not nearly as engaging as I would have liked.
He's excellent! He's really friendly and enthusiastic.
Enthusiastic, highly knowledgeable, and approachable. I wish we were able to interact with him more, as it felt that he was largely absent from the course, especially after midterm.
He is a great instructor. However,  class was a little disorganized.
Strong interests, but was not around much.
Good
Dr. Vasiliou cares about his students. The few lectures he gave were interesting and clear, however he did not lecture a majority of this course.
Great instructor with lots of energy and knowledge about toxicology. I appreciated how engaging his lectures were.

Strength: very knowledgeable and willing to interact with students
Weakness: Course structure may change in between

good professor with great speech skills. 
very busy....
Very helpful and knowledgeable about the subject!

Very passionate instructor that conveys the message really well and explains every concept in a very simple and efficient manner that makes you understand it and associate it with other related concepts in environmental health and toxicology.

I would not recommend this course to non-EHS students looking to satisfy their EHS course requirement. It is hard to understand and feels like it has minimal overlap with other topics studied by public health students.
great experience
variety of topics, sometimes over-reaching the knowledge of the class, but very cutting-edge topics discussed
Will recommend
Good and broad overview of toxicology with consideration of current technologies and issues in the field

An interesting course without too much burden.
Yes.
It's interesting.
I would not recommend it for someone interested in learning toxicology mechanisms. It gives a good overview of what toxicology is, but little hard information.
A series of guest lecturers and seminars on topics in public health toxicology. An interesting introduction to the field, but not a particularly deep dive on any one topic.
yes! I recommend.
This is a required course for EHS students-- I would recommend it to other students interested in learning about job opportunities in the field.
Like a seminar

This course is a survey of toxicological applications to the public health field. If a student has not background in this subject, this course is a good survey, however for those interested in mechanisms and biology, it is not very useful.
Yes, great intro to many topics in the field. Makes you think more critically about the world we live in.
Great course providing basic toxicology knowledge.
a little disappointing about the structure .  But the discussions among students are interesting.
An overview of toxicology from a big ideas point of view.
Excellent- certainly recommend
